org.js4ms.net.udp
Interface MulticastEndpoint

All Superinterfaces:
MessageInput<UdpDatagram>
All Known Implementing Classes:
AmtMulticastEndpoint
public interface MulticastEndpoint
extends MessageInput<UdpDatagram>

Interface exposed by objects that forward multicast datagrams as requested using the join and leave methods.

Author:
Greg Bumgardner (gbumgard)

Field Summary
 
Fields inherited from interface org.js4ms.channels.MessageInput

 void join(InetAddress groupAddress)
          Joins the specified any-source multicast group address.

          Joins the specified source-specific multicast source-group address pair.

          Starts forwarding of datagrams sent to the specified source-specific multicast address pair and UDP port number.
 void join(InetAddress groupAddress, int port)
          Starts forwarding of datagrams sent to the specified any-source multicast group address and UDP port number.
 void leave()
          Leaves all any-source and source-specific groups that are currently joined.

          Stops forwarding of datagrams sent to the specified group address and UDP port number.

Method Detail

join

void join(InetAddress groupAddress)
          throws IOException,
                 InterruptedException
Joins the specified any-source multicast group address.

Parameters:
groupAddress - The multicast group to join.
Throws:
IOException - The operation failed.
InterruptedException

join

void join(InetAddress groupAddress,
          InetAddress sourceAddress)
          throws IOException,
                 InterruptedException
Joins the specified source-specific multicast source-group address pair.

Parameters:
groupAddress - The multicast group to join.
sourceAddress - The address of a source for the specified group.
Throws:
IOException - The operation failed.
InterruptedException

join

void join(InetAddress groupAddress,
          int port)
          throws IOException,
                 InterruptedException
Starts forwarding of datagrams sent to the specified any-source multicast group address and UDP port number. This operation may result in the endpoint joining the specified group. See join(InetAddress).

Parameters:
groupAddress - The multicast group to join.
port - A UDP port number in the range 0-32767.
Throws:
IOException
InterruptedException

join

void join(InetAddress groupAddress,
          InetAddress sourceAddress,
          int port)
          throws IOException,
                 InterruptedException
Starts forwarding of datagrams sent to the specified source-specific multicast address pair and UDP port number. This operation may result in the endpoint joining the specified source-group pair. See join(InetAddress,InetAddress).

Parameters:
groupAddress - The multicast group to join.
sourceAddress - The address of a source for the specified group.
port - A UDP port number in the range 0-32767.
Throws:
IOException - The operation failed.
InterruptedException

leave

void leave(InetAddress groupAddress)
           throws IOException
Leaves the specified multicast group. This method will cause the endpoint to leave any any-source multicast group and all source-specific multicast pairs with that group address.

Parameters:
groupAddress - The multicast group to leave.
Throws:
IOException - The operation failed.

leave

void leave(InetAddress groupAddress,
           InetAddress sourceAddress)
           throws IOException
Leaves the specified source-specific multicast source group pair.

Parameters:
groupAddress - The multicast group to leave.
sourceAddress - The address of a source for the specified group.
Throws:
IOException - The operation failed.

leave

void leave(InetAddress groupAddress,
           int port)
           throws IOException
Stops forwarding of datagrams sent to the specified group address and UDP port number. This operation may result in the endpoint leaving the specified group address. See leave(InetAddress).

Parameters:
groupAddress - The multicast group to leave.
port - A UDP port number in the range 0-32767.
Throws:
IOException

leave

void leave(InetAddress groupAddress,
           InetAddress sourceAddress,
           int port)
           throws IOException
Stops forwarding of datagrams sent to the specified source-specific multicast source-group address pair and UDP port number. This operation may result in the endpoint leaving the source-group pair entirely. See leave(InetAddress,InetAddress).

Parameters:
groupAddress - The multicast group to leave.
sourceAddress - The address of a source for the specified group.
port - A UDP port number in the range 0-32767.
Throws:
IOException - The operation failed.

leave

void leave()
           throws IOException
Leaves all any-source and source-specific groups that are currently joined.

Throws:
IOException - The operation failed.
